Articles.Content: What do you think kerbal buildings would look like judging on what you've seen so far.
Depends are we basing this on the architecture of the current Space Center (.20 and below) or the future (.21) center complex?
It's probably the association with the time period but I imagine 1960s tract homes with sundress housewives and white shirt/black tie company men.
Pipes standard issue for the latter.

It's probably the association with the time period but I imagine 1960s tract homes with sundress housewives and white shirt/black tie company men.

That would so fit the theme as it stands right now!

Green.... Green Everywhere...

Either that or just little shacks. With sprawling underground bunkers. (They got used to random debris re-entering from space)

It's probably the association with the time period but I imagine 1960s tract homes with sundress housewives and white shirt/black tie company men.

Seconded. I love it.

It's probably the association with the time period but I imagine 1960s tract homes with sundress housewives and white shirt/black tie company men.

This makes part of me want to do some photoshoping, but the other part of me is too lazy to go and scan the image I'd want to edit..

I'd expect the ones near KSC would be, shall we say, in a rather distressed condition and maybe still burning. Those further away would (maybe) have a mixture fo styles.

I do kind of like Frederf's idea of 1960's picket fences etc, with a mixture of more strange architecture and civic buildings reminiscent of the new VAB and SPH.

Seconded. I love it.

/thirded.
Oh god that kerbal thing is scary.
That's really frightening.

That's really frightening.

Aw come on, she has a beautiful personality.

I'm going to have nightmares!!!!!

but um, that horrifying image aside, yes the 1960's florida suburbs is the look,

And don't forget about

The interior design.

Edited July 23, 2013 by Moon Goddess

For some reason i keep imagining a Kerbal on a tractor happily chugging along in a golden corn-field with a few barns nearby and a little country house, when suddenly a space-plane with Jeb in it breaks the sound barrier about 10 meters above his head, i'd say 1950's America would be great for kerbals, although of course i may have just drawn gasps of horror from some players but there you go, we all have a preference hehe.

I think that all of Kerbin is underground, with entrances all across Kerbin.

Imagine like regular neighborhood, but it has a big roof over it.

Same here, only I like to think it goes many layers deeper and occasionally extends into dense cavern systems, populated with strange and terrible monsters... and deeper still, legend has it that one may find a pillar of strange and miraculous metal ore. Metal ore that carries a terrifying curse.
obviously they should have a self destruct button right next to the button for the snack dispenser
I think Kerbin is covered in buildings that are half buried. with strong roofs and with only the ground floor half above ground (from all the space junk . . . and jebs flying antics).
Am I the only one who plays realistic/as if the Kerbals are not complete morons?

I play realistic and don't treat Kerbals as they are morons, obviously they're pretty smart if they have a space program. (check my blog post and you'll see that I don't.

I just like the idea of them having 1960's styling. I don't think that's stupid
I liked the 1960's idea. Although I also liked the idea of the stereotypical pimp.... Walking around strutting his stuff ... Shamless I know, but had to be done
